word: Concerning the site for the college, Mrs. White declared, "I am much pleased with the description of this place. . . . In such a place as Berrien Springs the school can be made an object lesson, and I hope that no one will interpose to prevent the carrying forward of this work."--Letter 80, 1901, p. 5. (To "Managers of the Review and Herald Office," July 12, 1901.) [Neff Manuscript, p. 93.]
